channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024050510
item.description:
Report X-2024050510

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-14T15:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. Inspection showed package to be wet with internal leakage, on its side, and 1 of 4 items with a loose cap. Damage most likely caused from being placed on wrong conveyor belt. Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2024050428
item.description:
Report X-2024050428

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: PARSIPPANY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. PACKAGE WAS A ULINE INSULATED SHIPPER BOX PREPRINTED RUSH, PERISHABLE INSULATED WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FOUR POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING WHAT APPEARS TO BE A FOOD PRODUCT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM NEW JERSEY USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 015EX7, THE UPS STORE #1611, 163 E MAIN ST, LITTLE FALLS NJ 07424-1711.
